sentence.Network_en: Frank's remarks always vivify an otherwise dull story.
sentence.Network_cn: 弗兰克的评语总能让乏味的故事生动起来.

sentence.Network_en: His remarks always vivify an otherwise dull story.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的讲话总能让原本平淡无奇的故事变得栩栩如生.

sentence.Network_en: A smile may vivify a face.
sentence.Network_cn: 笑容使面部表情生动起来.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French vivifier, from late Latin vivificare, from Latin vivus 'living', from vivere 'to live'

means.word_mean: 1. give new life or energy to;

sentences.sentence: "his remarks always vivify an otherwise dull story"

auth_sentence.content: His ready wit seldom failed...to illustrate and vivify what was said.
